MARRIAGE
Name: Walter LALLATHIN
and Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Stella EDDY
Source: The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., Jan. 12, 1933
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
A wedding of interest to the many friends of the principals was that of Walter Lallathin and Miss Stella Eddy. The marriage was solemnized in Steubenville on Tuesday afternoon, January 3, 1933.
The bride is the attractive daughter ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A wedding of interest to the many friends of the principals was that of Walter Lallathin and Miss Stella Eddy. The marriage was solemnized in Steubenville on Tuesday afternoon, January 3, 1933.
The bride is the attractive daughter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. and Mrs. Bert Eddy of West Union, and her husband is the eldest son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Lallathin of Home Avenue, Woodsfield. They will reside in Woodsfield. Many friends extend congratulations <<<<<<< HEAD and best wishes.
======= and best wishes. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

MARRIAGE
Names: Lloyd LEACH
and Miss Versa L. Brown
Source: Names: Lloyd LEACH
and Miss Versa L. Brown
Source: >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., Jan. 12, 1933
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
A wedding of interest to the many ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A wedding of interest to the many >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 friends of the principal was solemnized in Woodsfield on Friday, January 6, 1933, when Lloyd Leach and Miss Versa L. Brown were united in marriage. Squire W. A. Cronin officiated.
Mrs. Leach is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Abel Brown, of Summerfield, Ohio and her husband is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Leach also of Summerfield.

1933XXXXX
DEATH
Name: Leander Ault
Source: The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., Jan. 12, 1933
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Lee Ault, aged 74 years and a highly respected citizen of Woodsfield passed away at his home near Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, Tuesday afternoon, January 10, 1933, at 4:00. Death was due to influenza followed by ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lee Ault, aged 74 years and a highly respected citizen of Woodsfield passed away at his home near Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, Tuesday afternoon, January 10, 1933, at 4:00. Death was due to influenza followed by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 pneumonia.
He is survived by his wife; two ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He is survived by his wife; two >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 sons, Arthur of Eastern Avenue, and Clifford, of Columbus, Ohio; one daughter, Mrs. Bessie Dougherty; one sister, Mrs. Belle Naylor, of Jerusalem, Ohio and one brother Thomas Ault, of Jerusalem, besides many other relatives and friends who are sad to learn of his death.
Funeral services will be held this Thursday afternoon at 3:00 oclock at the Woodsfield Church of Christ with Evangelist J. V. A. Traylor in charge. Interment will be mad in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services will be held this Thursday afternoon at 3:00 o clock at the Woodsfield Church of Christ with Evangelist J. V. A. Traylor in charge. Interment will be mad in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
1933
Yoho, Frank Lewis
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
SOURCE: THE BLOOMFIELD NEWS, Bloomfield, Greene County, Indiana, Thursday, January 26, 1933, Volume XVII, Number 13, Page 6, Columns 4 & 5, <<<<<<< HEAD DEATHS HARVEST. YOHO. [Transcribed 26 Aug 2000 from Bloomfield-Eastern Greene County Public Librarys IHS Microfilm Records.]
Frank Lewis YOHO, oldest son of ======= DEATH S HARVEST. YOHO. [Transcribed 26 Aug 2000 from Bloomfield-Eastern Greene County Public Library s IHS Microfilm Records.]
Frank Lewis YOHO, oldest son of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Isaac Mahlon and Sarah E. YOHO, was born in Noble County, Ohio October 28, 1866, and died January 10, 1933.
The parents left their The parents left their >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Ohio home and became one of the early settlers of Indiana, locating in Monroe County.
His grandfather, Samuel YOHO, saw ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His grandfather, Samuel YOHO, saw >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 service in the Mexican War.
His father, Mahlon YOHO served three ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His father, Mahlon YOHO served three >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and one-half years in the Union Army during the Civil War, campaigning with the eastern armies.
The family moved to a farm near ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The family moved to a farm near >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Solsberry, Greene County. Here Frank grew to manhood and married Effie FRAME, the daughter of Jacob and Martha FRAME, 1888.
He served four years as mail carrier ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He served four years as mail carrier >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 out of Solsberry. In 1904 he purchased a general store here and had been in the same store until the time of his death.
Early in life he became a member of M. E. church of Solsberry. He was a member of the Mens ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Early in life he became a member of M. E. church of Solsberry. He was a member of the Men s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Bible class, where he was never found missing until a few weeks ago, when his health would not permit him to attend.
He was affiliated with the Solsberry ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was affiliated with the Solsberry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Masonic fraternity Lodge No. 411 F. & A. M., and also the Improved Order of Red Men.
He served two terms as commissioner ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He served two terms as commissioner >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of the First district of Greene County, his time expiring in December. He always was conscientious in his work, dong what he thought best. In this field of work he won many true friends.
In 1910, Marthena, the infant ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In 1910, Marthena, the infant >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Charley and Jessie (FRAME) JOHNSON, was taken in his home.
In 1912, Mrs. YOHO passed away. He ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In 1912, Mrs. YOHO passed away. He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Marthena were taken into the home of his father and mother, where they lived until his mother passed away. In 1925 Marthena was married to Wayne SHERROW. These two have made home happy for him. Two little children came into the home, which afforded him much joy. Little DeWayne was taken seven months ago. His going saddened the life of his foster grandfather.
His father, mother and one sister ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His father, mother and one sister >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 have passed on.
The surviving relatives are Walter, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The surviving relatives are Walter, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Oscar, Will and Mrs. Mayme CORWIN, of Solsberry; Mrs. Della ORCHARD, of Bloomington, and Mrs. Myrtle BARNES, of Indianapolis; the foster daughter, Marthena, husband and baby. A large number of other relatives and true friends are left to mourn his going.
Fades, fades, our earthly joys. Breaks every tender tie; farewell mortality, welcome eternity; farewell loved ones, welcome sweet scene of rest; welcome my Saviors breast.
Honorary pallbearers were H. L. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Fades, fades, our earthly joys. Breaks every tender tie; farewell mortality, welcome eternity; farewell loved ones, welcome sweet scene of rest; welcome my Savior s breast.
Honorary pallbearers were H. L. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 DONEY, Wm. VOSLOH, Charles DAVIS, Harry LANDIS, Jake GARRETT, Roll BUSKIRK, Elmer SHERWOOD, James PRIEST, William BROWN, Earl HUFFMAN, James M. HUDSON, and E. V. BULL.
We wish to express our sincere ======= mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'>
We wish to express our sincere >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 thanks to the many friends for their kindness and sympathy during the sickness and death of our Brother and Father; also for the many beautiful floral offerings.
Brothers and Sisters
Mr. & Mrs. Wayne SHERROW.

1933
Mrs. Ethel Green
Death of Mrs. Ethel Green
January 12, 1933
Mrs. Ethel Green, age 37 years, daughter of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'>
Mrs. Ethel Green, age 37 years, daughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. and Mrs. John Rothaker, of Round Bottom, died at her home at Jacobsburg, Belmont County, on Tuesday afternoon at 1:00 o'clock. She is survived by her husband, her parents and several brothers and sisters.
Funeral services will be held at the home of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services will be held at the home of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her parents on Friday afternoon at 1:00 o'clock followed by final obsequies at The Salem Evangelical Church. Interment will be made in the church cemetery.

MARRIAGE
Names: Mr. Francis Burkhart
and Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Dorothy Ackerman
Source: The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., Jan. 12, 1933
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Miss Dorothy Ackerman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Ackerman, of Woodsfield Route 3, and Mr. Francis Burkhart, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. N. Burkhart, also of Woodsfield Route 3 were united in marriage at 7:00 oclock on Monday morning, January 9, 1933 at St. Sylvesters ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Dorothy Ackerman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Ackerman, of Woodsfield Route 3, and Mr. Francis Burkhart, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. N. Burkhart, also of Woodsfield Route 3 were united in marriage at 7:00 o clock on Monday morning, January 9, 1933 at St. Sylvester s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Catholic Church, Woodsfield. The pastor, Reverend J. G. Mehler, officiated at the exchange of the marriage vows.
The attendants were Mrs. Edith ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The attendants were Mrs. Edith >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cannon, of Columbus, Ohio and John Burkhart, of Woodsfield, sister and brother of the groom. A few near relatives and friends also witnessed the ceremony.
Following the wedding a breakfast ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Following the wedding a breakfast >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was served at the Columbia Hotel to the following: Mr. and Mrs. Francis Burkhart, Mrs. Edith Cannon, John Burkhart, Reverend J. G. Mehler and Charles Brubach.
The bride and groom are both members of fine families and have the best wishes of their many friends.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The bride and groom are both members of fine families and have the best wishes of their many friends. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

DEATH
Name: Michael J. YOUNG
Source: The Monroe County Republican
Woodsfield, Ohio in the year of 1933
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
The Angel of death has again entered ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The Angel of death has again entered >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 our home and taken from our midst a dearly beloved husband and father, Michael J. YOUNG, who was the last of a family of five.
He was born October 28, 1849, in He was born October 28, 1849, in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Summit Township, Monroe County and departed his life on January 23, 1933, being at the time of his death 83 years, 2 months, 26 days.
He united with the German Evangelical Church at the age of 14 years and remained a faithful member until death. His entire life was spent in the home where ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He united with the German Evangelical Church at the age of 14 years and remained a faithful member until death. His entire life was spent in the home where >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 he was born.
On May 20, 1877, he was united in marriage with Mollie FRANK and to this union nine children were born. All are living except Freeman who preceded ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On May 20, 1877, he was united in marriage with Mollie FRANK and to this union nine children were born. All are living except Freeman who preceded >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 him in death on August 18, 1920.
He was a devoted husband, loving father and a kind neighbor. He leaves to ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was a devoted husband, loving father and a kind neighbor. He leaves to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mourn his departure, his widow and eight children, namely: Edward and George, of Miltonsburg; Elmer, of Cleveland; Charles, Frank and Harold, of Lewisville; Mrs. Walter TAYLOR, of Bowling Green, Florida, and Oscar, of the home; eleven <<<<<<< HEAD grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. ======= grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Several nieces and nephews and a host of friends also mourn his departure. He will be sadly missed not only in his home but in the entire neighborhood.
The body was laid to rest in the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body was laid to rest in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 family lot at Middle Church on January 26th.
He has not left us, but has gone before. There will be a reunion if we also hold fast in our faith in Jesus Christ as our Redeemer.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He has not left us, but has gone before. There will be a reunion if we also hold fast in our faith in Jesus Christ as our Redeemer. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

1933
DEATH
April 27, 1933
This is an obit for Wilford Eugene Graham, son of Luther Oril Graham and Sara B. Betts Graham
 
Obituary
Wilfred ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Wilfred >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Eugene, infant son of Mr. and Mrs. L. O. Graham, residing south of Tiro, was born at the home of his parents, April 25, and departed from this life, April 27, at the age of two days.
 
He leaves ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to mourn his departure his father and mother, two brothers, Vernon Wayne and Joseph Robert, and one sister, Ruth Alene, and a great many other relatives and friends.
 
There is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> There is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a Reaper, whose name is Death,
 
And, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with his sickle keen,
 
He reaps ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He reaps >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bearded grain at a breath,
 
And the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 flowers that grow between,
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 "Shall I have naught that is fair?" saith he;
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 "Have naught but the bearded grain?
 
Though ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Though >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the breath of these flowers is sweet to me,
 
I will give them all back again?"
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> I will give them all back again?" >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
He gazed ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He gazed >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at the flowers with tearful eyes,
 
He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 kissed their drooping leaves;
 
It was for the Lord of Paradise,
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> It was for the Lord of Paradise, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
He bound ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He bound >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 them in his sheaves.
 
"My ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> "My >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lord has need of these flowerets gay,"
 
The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reaper said, and smiled,
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 "Dear tokens of the earth are they,
 
Where he ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Where he >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was once a child."
 
"They shall all bloom in fields of light
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> "They shall all bloom in fields of light >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Transplanted by my care,
 
And ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 saints upon their garments white,
 
These ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> These >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 sacred blossoms wear."
 
And the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mother gave in tears and pain,
 
The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 flowers she most did love;
 
She knew she should find them all again
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She knew she should find them all again >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
In the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 fields of light above,
 
O, not ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> O, not >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in cruelty, not in wrath,
 
The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reaper came that day;
 
"T ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> "T >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was an angel visited the green earth
 
And took ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> And took >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the flowers away.
 
[Source: Obituary for Wilford Eugene Graham, found in the Bible belonging to Sara Beatrice Betts Graham; poem called The Reaper and the Flowers by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow]

1933
DEATH
Name: Magdalena Weber
Source: Newspaper article, June 1933
Provided by Eloise Lumbatis January
Magdalena Weber, daughter of Charles ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Magdalena Weber, daughter of Charles >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Salome Weber, was born January 15, 1854, and died June 26, 1933, at the old home near Lewisville, aged 79 years, 5 months and 11 days old at the time of her death.
She is survived by six brothers, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She is survived by six brothers, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Henry, George, Jacob, Fred, Philip, and Otto, all living near Lewisville. Two brothers, Christian and David, and three sisters, Miss Louise Weber, Mrs. Mary Neuhart and one infant sister preceded her in death.
Miss Weber was confirmed in the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Weber was confirmed in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Evangelical faith in 1868. To this faith she was ever true. For many years she was intensely interested in all departments of the churches at Lewisville, Buchanan and Middle Church, but for the past several years she had made her church home at Buchanan, it being more convenient an d her health delicate. She <<<<<<< HEAD had been at the head of the Childrens department in the Sunday School at Buchanan for many years and had always remembered each little one at Easter and Christmas. On the Sunday preceding her death she sent flowers for the annual Childrens Day held at Buchanan.
A few days before her death Aunt ======= had been at the head of the Children s department in the Sunday School at Buchanan for many years and had always remembered each little one at Easter and Christmas. On the Sunday preceding her death she sent flowers for the annual Children s Day held at Buchanan.
A few days before her death Aunt >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lena was stricken with measles, a disease she had always feared and shunned. Jut when she seemed to have conquered the disease and we thought she would soon be about again, she slipped quietly away. Dying as she lived, quietly and uncomplainingly, leaving the entire community shocked and sorrowing. It had <<<<<<< HEAD been her wish to celebrate this summer ======= been her wish to celebrate this summer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the 100th anniversary of the coming of the Weber family to Monroe county from Germany. We are sorry she could not live to have her wish fulfilled. She who was always so mindful of the comfort of each member of the entire family, practically every one of whom had known her generosity and good will.
Funeral services were held at Buchanan Presbyterian Church on Wednesday afternoon, conducted by Rev. Henry Fox, of St. Peters Evangelical ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services were held at Buchanan Presbyterian Church on Wednesday afternoon, conducted by Rev. Henry Fox, of St. Peter s Evangelical >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church, Woodsfield, and Rev. W. H. Petry, her pastor, followed by burial in the family lot in Buchanan cemetery. She was born to her resting place by six nephews.
 
Thou too hast left us, while with heads bowed ======= mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Thou too hast left us, while with heads bowed >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 low,
And sorrowing <<<<<<< HEAD hearts, we mourned our summers ======= hearts, we mourned our summer s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 dead.
Was Heaven <<<<<<< HEAD impatient that it could not wait.
The blasts of winter for earths fruits to fall?
Were angels crowding round the open gate,
======= impatient that it could not wait.
The blasts of winter for earth s fruits to fall?
Were angels crowding round the open gate,
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
To greet the spirits coming at their call?
Death reaches not a spirit such as thine,
It can but steal the robe that hid thy wings.
Still in our <<<<<<< HEAD hearts thy loving memory clings.

1933 XXXXX
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> XXXXX >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Margaret Ellen McMahon, nee Schneider
Source: Newspaper clipping, Monroe County, OH, September 1933
  Margaret Ellen Schneider McMahon was born at Neuhart Ridge on July 18, 1869 and passed away very suddenly at her home at Kerr Station on September 18, 1933. She had attained the age of 64 years and two months.
  In 1901 she was united in marriage with John McMahon. Two sons, William and Albert, blessed this union who with their father mourn her sudden death and loss.
  The day before her death she was her usual self, waiting on her family the same as always. Illness, sudden and acute seized her and death followed shortly.
  Beside her immediate family she leaves to mourn her death three sisters, Mrs. Catherine Millbaugh, of Lower Salem; Mrs. Louisa Hoff, of Antioch, and Mrs. Anna Christman of Woodsfield, and one brother John Schneider of Woodsfield Route 1, besides a host of other relatives and friends.
  On Wednesday afternoon, September 20, at 2 o'clock a throng of relatives and friends paid their last tribute of respect to her sterling qualities as a neighbor, sister, friend, mother and wife. Rev. Henry Fox, pastor of St. Paul's Evangelical Church, was in charge of the services and was assisted by Evangelist J. V. A. Traylor, pastor of the Woodsfield Church of Christ. The services were opened and closed by the singing of appropriate hymns. Rev. Fox used as his text the 12th verse of the ninetieth Psalm, and showed how the departed had applied her heart unto wisdom in serving her dear ones, her fellowman and her Creator. The great abundance of flowers expressed the high esteem in which she was held by her many relatives and friends and by whom she will be sadly missed. Following the services interment was made in Oak Lawn Cemetery.
Card of Thanks: We desire in this way to express our sincere thanks and appreciation to our many neighbors and friends for the kind deeds and expressions of sympathy extended to us during the short illness and at the time of the death of our dear wife and mother. Such kindness shall always be remembered.--John McMahon and Sons.

1934
 
Allen Forest Latta
Source:  MONROE COUNTY, OHIO OBITUARIES, Vol 2 (22 Feb 1934)
Dr. A. F. Latta passed away at his home at Cumberland, Ohio according to word received this Thursday morning.  He was born and reared in the Calais community and for many years was a successful practicing physician at Graysville before moving to Cumberland.  He is survived by his son Dr. R. H. Latta of Graysville.  Interment was made in Calais cemetery, Monroe. Co.

DEATH
Name: Charles Henry Weber
Source: Newspaper article, March 1934
Provided by Eloise Lumbatis January
Charles Henry Weber was born April ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Charles Henry Weber was born April >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 9th, 1864, in Monroe County, near Lewisville, Route 2, Ohio, being the ninth child of Charles Christian and Salome Weber. Childhood and young manhood were spent in this neighborhood. In 1889, he married Elizabeth Motter, the two making their home on the farm where both lived the remainder of their life and died. Both the farm and the home overlooking Woodsfield, bespeak of thrift and industry and cooperation. Here four children blessed their union and with them served in bringing family happiness and well being as a fundamental part of life.
Seven years ago his good wife was taken ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Seven years ago his good wife was taken >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by death.
On Tuesday, March 13, 1934, at 4:30 ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On Tuesday, March 13, 1934, at 4:30 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a.m. the final summons came, suddenly and unexpectedly.
One son, Lucian, died in One son, Lucian, died in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">France during the world war. Thus there remain to mourn his sudden departure his sons, Arnold Weber and Clarence Weber and one daughter, Helen Weber Smith; three grandchildren and five brothers, Philip, Fred, George, Jacob and Otto Weber.
As a final tribute to his worth as ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> As a final tribute to his worth as >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 citizen, neighbor, friend, Christian and relative a large concourse of Monroe County folks as well as those from a distance met for the funeral services in the home, Thursday, March 15th, at 2:00 p.m. where services were conducted by his pastor, Henry Fox. Briefly and simply the facts of his useful life were told. <<<<<<< HEAD These thoughts were dwelt upon: I will not leave you comfortless, whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with all thy might and teach us to number our days that we may get us a heart of wisdom.
The interment followed in Oaklawn ======= These thoughts were dwelt upon: I will not leave you comfortless, whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with all thy might and teach us to number our days that we may get us a heart of wisdom.
The interment followed in Oaklawn >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 cemetery where his many friends stood in awed silence. During the time between his sudden death and his burial the family received innumerable proofs of the love and the esteem in which Henry Weber was held by Woodsfield and center Township, for which they express their deepest appreciation and thanks. So at the age of 69 years, eleven months and four days this earthly life ended with his kindly Christian influence to live on through those whom God had given him.

1934
Leach, Stella
Mrs. Frank Neuhart - nee Estella "Stella" Leach
Source: Quaker City [Ohio] Home Towner, Friday 27 April 1934
Funeral services were held Friday afternoon at the home near Batesville for Mrs. Frank Neuhart, 60, a life-long resident of Noble County. Services were in charge of Rev. A. A. Gilmore and interment was made at Friends Cemetery.
 
She was married in 1890, her maiden name being Leach. Her husband and the following children survive; Forest A. and William O. Neuhart and Mrs. G. F. McPeek, Batesville; Mrs. Carlos Eshbaugh, Eldon; Mrs. Charles Betts, Freeport; and Gladys of the home. She also leaves five brothers, one sister and 17 grandchildren. One brother, a sister and one grandchild preceded her in death.

McMahon, Daniel Hanlon
Source: Newspaper clipping, Monroe County Ohio, August 1934
  Daniel McMahon, aged 82 years, passed away at his home near Goudy's east of Woodsfield about 2:00 o'clock Tuesday morning August 14, 1934. He had been in failing health for several years but was seriously ill for only about two weeks.
  He is survived by one sister, Mrs. Roena Warfield of Neffs and by two brothers, William J. McMahon of Neffs and John B. McMahon of west of Woodsfield. A number of other relatives and a host of friends also mourn his death.
  Funeral services were held this Thursday afternoon, short services being held at the home followed by final rites at Goudy church in charge of Elder C. L. Mellott of Woodsfield. Interment was in the church cemetery. [Daniel was born 12 September 1852 in Monroe County, a son of Isaac and Jennetta (Hanlon) McMahon]

1935
OBIT Jan. 5, 1935 Frederick Reef Egger
Reef Egger, Well Known Publisher of Pagosa Is Called By Death Today
 
Sun, acting postmaster at Pagosa, and clerk of the district court in Archuleta county, passed away at his home in Pagosa, at 5:00 o'clock this morning, (January 5, 1935) as the result of pneumonia following a nervous breakdown and an attack of the flu.
 
The deceased was one of the most widely known men in Archuleta county, having spent the major part of his life in that section.
 
He was born in Woodfield, O., in 1890, and when a small child moved to Pagosa Springs with his <<<<<<< HEAD father and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Dan Egger. ======= father and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Dan Egger. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Soon after moving to Pagosa Dan Egger became engaged in the newspaper business; in 1909 Reef moved with his father to Bayfield where they established the Bayfield Blade; in 1911, Reef returned to Pagosa.
 
When the United States entered the World War Reef joined the army and served until the Armistice was signed.
 
In 1919 he returned to Pagosa Springs where he purchased the Pagosa Sun, which he publilshed continulously thereafter until called by death.
 
For the past fifteen years he had served as clerk of the district court in Archuleta county.
 
Reef joined the American Legion soon after the organization was formed and was very active in Legion circles.
 
During his many years of community service Reef Egger acquired a host of friends from every walk in life, who feel keenly the loss of a loving husband and father, a loyal friend, and an upright and honorable business man.
 
The deceased is survived by his wife, Mrs. Gertrude Egger, and two soons, Reef, Jr., 5, and Kirklin, 2, of Pagosa Springs; his mother, Mrs. M.A. Egger, of Los Angeles; two sisters, Mrs. C.A.Douglass, of Los Angeles and Mrs. H.A. Owen of Ignacio; and two brothers, Raymond Egger and Roy Egger, of Pagosa Springs.
 
Funeral arrangements have not been made pending word from relatives who reside at <<<<<<< HEAD distant points. It is known, however, ======= distant points. It is known, however, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 that he will be laid to rest with full military honors.

DEATH

J. W. Weber

Source: Spirit <<<<<<< HEAD of Democracy, dated, March 14, 1935

Dr. J. W. Weber, prominent physician of

Dr. J. W. Weber, prominent physician of >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Monroe County, passed away at his home in Lewisville early Saturday morning ( Mar. 9, 1935). Dr. Weber had been engaged in the practice of medicine for 53 years being located for the greater portion of that time in Lewisville. He served as Monroe County Health Commissioner for several years.

A few weeks ago Dr. Weber fell when he ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A few weeks ago Dr. Weber fell when he >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 slipped on some ice near his home and at the time thought he was not seriously injured. A few days later he became ill and was taken to the Good Samaritan Hospital when it was revealed that he had sustained several broken ribs. Community Good Samaritan Hospital, Zanesville, where it was revealed that he had <<<<<<< HEAD sustained several broken ribs. ======= sustained several broken ribs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Complications from the injury hastened his death.

He is survived by his widow, Mrs. Caroline Ludwig Weber; one son, Atty. A. C. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> He is survived by his widow, Mrs. Caroline Ludwig Weber; one son, Atty. A. C. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Weber, of Toledo and one daughter, Mrs. W. E. Githens, also of Toledo. A number of other relatives also survive. Dr. Weber had made for himself a legion of friends by who he will be sadly missed. He was well and favorable known throughout the entire county and his death is mourned by scores of people.

Fraternally he was a member of Monroe ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Fraternally he was a member of Monroe >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ledge No. 189, F. & A. M. and also of the Knights of Pythias. He was also a member of the Lewisville Evangelical Church.

Funeral services were held at the late ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services were held at the late >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 home in Lewisville at 2:00 o'clock Tuesday afternoon in charge of the pastor Rev. Robert Johnson. Ritualistic services were conducted by Monroe Lodge No. 189, F. & A. M. and burial was made in Friendship Cemetery at Lewisville.

DEATH
Name: Frank John OGDEN
Source: Monroe County death records
Woodsfield, Ohio, September 27, 1935

DEATH
Name: Catherine Thompson Lumbatis
Provided by Eloise Lumbatis January
Catherine Lumbatis, daughter of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Catherine Lumbatis, daughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 James and Katy Thompson, born February 26, 1863. Died December 25, 1935, aged 72 years, 9 months and 29 days. Became a member of the Methodist Church at the age of 15 years and was a faithful member and attendant until her infirmities forced her to remain away but the Bible was her comfort and guide.
She was married to Stephen L. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She was married to Stephen L. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lumbatis December 1887, who preceded her in death in September 1933. To this union were born four sons, Stallie, George, Earl and Harold.
Three sisters, Mrs. Lide Law of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Three sisters, Mrs. Lide Law of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Marietta, Mrs. Bitha Dickson, New Matamoras; mrs. Mary McCall, Chester, W. Va.; eleven grandchildren, with hosts of others are left to mourn her loss.

December 19, 1935

DEATH

Elizabeth Heft

Source: Spirit of Democracy

Mrs. Elizabeth Heft, aged 82, passed away ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Elizabeth Heft, aged 82, passed away >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at her home at Lewisville on Thursday, December 5th at11: 00 p.m. after an illness of a few days duration. Mrs. Heft was one the oldest residents of the Lewisville community and was affectionately known to almost everyone as "Grandma Heft."

She was born on April 19, 1853 in She was born on April 19, 1853 in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Germany where she lived until 19 years of age, when she came to New York. Four years later she was united in marriage to Lewis Heft, Sr. A few years later they moved from New York to Monroe County where they have since lived.

Mrs. Heft leaves her husband, Lewis Heft, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Heft leaves her husband, Lewis Heft, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Sr. who is 91 years of age; two sons, Lewis Heft, Jr. and John Heft of Lewisville and three daughters, Mrs. Kathryn Widmer, of Bound Book, N. J.; Mrs. Anna Brandeau of McMechen W. Va.; and Mrs. Carl Schaller, of Cleveland. Seventeen grandchildren and three great-grandchildren besides a number of other relatives and a host of friends. One daughter, Amelia preceded her in death in the year 1928.

Funeral services in charge of Rev. Robert ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services in charge of Rev. Robert >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Johnson, were conducted on Sunday afternoon, December 8th in the Lewisville Evangelical Church. Interment was made in Friendship Cemetery.

1936
   ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Death of Duncan Highman
 Published in The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, January 2,1936)
   Duncan Highman, well known resident of Sarahsville, died suddenly when stricken with a heart attack at the family home, Christmas  Eve, Dec.24th, while the family had gathered and were opening the Christmas presents. Mr. Highman who was a prominant farmer and sheep raiser,was 72 years old. He was born in Woodsfield, Monroe County, but had lived most of his life in Noble County. His parents were Marquis and Mary Snyder Highman.
   Surviving are his widow, eight children, S.O. Highman of Sarahsville; Thurman Highman,of Chicago; Arch Highman of Ashland; Clem Highman , of the home; Mrs. Mary Bradley and Mrs.Anna Schumate, both of Zanesville, and Miss Rita Highman, of the home; one sister and two brothers, Sylvester Highman of Ashland; Mrs. Ella Dougherty of Toronto; Charles Highman ,of Woodsfield,Ohio.
   Funeral services were held from the late home Friday afternoon, December 27 th, at 1:00 o'clock, conducted by Rev. Orton L. Orr and interment was in The First Cemetery at Sarahsville.
 
 
Rosenlieb, Sarah E.

Rev. Father Joseph Finan officiated and burial was made in the church cemetery.

(Daughter of John and Catherine Okey Brister) Surviving are three daughters and one son, a brother Joseph Brister, of Lewisville Route, and three sisters Mrs. Alice Knopf and Mrs. Retta Kindelberger, of Lewisville Route and Mrs. H. H. Dearth, of Summerfield. 1936
DEATH
Name: Philip S. Weber
Source: The Spirit of Democracy
Dated Thursday, May 30, 1936
Philip S. Weber, son of Charles and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Philip S. Weber, son of Charles and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Salome Weber, was born in Summit Township, Monroe county, Ohio, September 20, 1849 and died at his home in Lewisville, Ohio, April 12, 1936, being at the time of his death, 86 years, six months and twenty-two days of age. He was united in marriage to Matilda J. Brown on November 13, 1881. To them were born three children; Alfred C. Weber, John H. Weber and Mrs. Rosa L. Fisher, all living near the home.
He leaves to mourn his departure, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He leaves to mourn his departure, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 his wife, three children, seventeen grandchildren, four great grandchildren, four brothers, George, Fred, Jacob and Otto Weber, and many other relatives and friends. Three sisters and three brothers preceded him in death.
He was confirmed at the age of 14 ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was confirmed at the age of 14 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 years in the Middle Church, which church the Weber family formerly attended and in which church cemetery, his parents are buried. Uncle Philip as he was known by many spent his entire life in the community where he was born. His parents coming from Germany were among the pioneer settlers of the County. He was a life of toil and honest endeavor. He has seen many changes and improvements during his longer than the usual span of life and no one enjoyed more the simple pleasures of everyday life than he until the past year when he became too infirm to leave his home. For the last seven weeks he required the care of his family continually. The end came peacefully at the Easter time and to those dearest to him will be associated in memory the Resurrection season and of the <<<<<<< HEAD Redeemer who said Because I live ye shall live also.
======= Redeemer who said Because I live ye shall live also. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
When beneath <<<<<<< HEAD some heavy load your heart is sad;
When it seems you cannot ever smile again
God, who let the sorrow come, will make you glad;
Hes the one who sends the sunshine and ======= some heavy load your heart is sad;
When it seems you cannot ever smile again
God, who let the sorrow come, will make you glad;
He s the one who sends the sunshine and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the rain.
Funeral services were held Wednesday afternoon with short services at his home in Lewisville after which the body was taken to the Buchanan Presbyterian church for final obsquies. He was a member of the Presbyterian church. Burial was made in the church cemetery.
Gillespie, H. P.

Marriage
Names: Mr. Albert PAULUS
and Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Imogene YOUNG
Source: The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., Apr. 30, 1936
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
A wedding of much interest to the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A wedding of much interest to the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 many friends of the principals was solemnized in the St. Paul's Evangelical Church parsonage on South Main Street, Wednesday, April 22, when Miss Imogene Young, popular young lady of the Lewisville community, became the bride of Albert Paulus, of Woodsfield. Reverend Henry Fox officiated at the exchange of the wedding vows in the presence of close relatives of the couple.
The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Young, of Lewisville Route 1, while her husband is a son of Mrs. Rosa Hoff, of Woodsfield. Imogene is a graduate of Lewisville High School, class of 1935. The happy couple have the congratulations and best wishes of their many friends.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Young, of Lewisville Route 1, while her husband is a son of Mrs. Rosa Hoff, of Woodsfield. Imogene is a graduate of Lewisville High School, class of 1935. The happy couple have the congratulations and best wishes of their many friends. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Mrs. J. R. Bates

SOURCE: Republican

======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Republican

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

 

Mrs. Rosa Bates, aged 67 years, wife of J. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Rosa Bates, aged 67 years, wife of J. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 R. Bates, of Quaker City, R. D., passed away at the family home, Friday evening, following two days illness.

Born October 18, 1868 in Monroe County, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Born October 18, 1868 in Monroe County, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the daughter of Phillip and Rosina Pfalzgraf Christman, she was united in marriage August 20, 1892 to J. R. Bates. They resided in the Quaker City vicinity since March 1893. Mrs. Bates was a devout member of the Quaker City M. E. Church and was held in high esteem in that community, her death grieving a legion of friends. Her husband is chairman of the board of directors on the Quaker City Creamery Co.

In addition to her husband, she leaves two ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In addition to her husband, she leaves two >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 children, Mrs. Chester Watson and Mrs. Rodney Gibson, both of Quaker City R. D. and the following brothers, and sisters; George L. Christman, Mrs. Lena Ackerman, Mrs. Eva Carpenter, Mrs. Barbara Morris, Mrs. Mary Miller and Mrs. Sally Betts.

Funeral services were held Sunday ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services were held Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon at 2:00 o'clock at the home in charge of Rev. Gilmore, pastor of the Quaker City M. E. Church. Burial was made in Friends cemetery

1936
WILLIAM EUGENE YOHO
 
[Source: Wheeling News Register, Monday, Sept. 14, 1936]
 
W. E. YOHO, 89, <<<<<<< HEAD DIES SUNDAY:WELL KNOWN PETERS RUN FARMER SUCCUMBED TO FIVE MONTHS ILLNESS
======= DIES SUNDAY:WELL KNOWN PETER S RUN FARMER SUCCUMBED TO FIVE MONTHS ILLNESS >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
William Eugene <<<<<<< HEAD Yoho, 89, well-known Ohio county farmer and a resident of Peters Run road for the past 44 years, succumbed to an illness of five months duration at 6:08 oclock, Sunday evening, at his home.
======= Yoho, 89, well-known Ohio county farmer and a resident of Peter s Run road for the past 44 years, succumbed to an illness of five months duration at 6:08 o clock, Sunday evening, at his home. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Mr. Yoho was born in Monroe county, Ohio, August 13, 1847, a son of Jacob and Christina Stein Yoho. He came to Ohio county nearly half a century ago and had engaged in farming up until the time of his illness.
 
His wife, Sarah E. Smith Yoho preceded him in death 12 years ago. Surviving are three sons, five daughters, two half-brothers, three half-sisters, 28 grandchildren and 39 great grandchildren.
 
The body was removed to the Crider funeral home where services will be held Tuesday <<<<<<< HEAD afternoon at 3 oclock. Rev. A. Coleman Brown, pastor of the Elm Grove ======= afternoon at 3 o clock. Rev. A. Coleman Brown, pastor of the Elm Grove >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Methodist church, will officiate. Interment will follow in Stone Church cemetery.

Source: Newspaper clipping, 1936
Collection of Beryl Christman Claus
Dr. H. P. Gillespie, aged 69 years, passed away at his home on North main street at 9:00 oclock Wednesday morning, He had been in failing health for ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Dr. H. P. Gillespie, aged 69 years, passed away at his home on North main street at 9:00 o clock Wednesday morning, He had been in failing health for >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 some time but was able to be out in an automobile on Tuesday. He suffered a heart attack on Wednesday morning which resulted in his death.
He is survived by his wife, one ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He is survived by his wife, one >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter, Mrs. A. R. Burkhart, of Eastern avenue and two sons, Dr. Myron Gillespie of North Main street and Dr. Emerson Gillespie of Canton, Ohio; five grandchildren; two brothers Reverend Hugh Gillespie of Cincinnati, and T. T. Gillespie of Woodsfield Route 4; and three sisters, Mrs. R. V. Boyd of Newark, Ohio; Mrs. W. A. Cronin of Paul street and Mrs. Charles R. Norris of Woodsfield Route 4, a number of other relatives also survive.
Dr. Gillespie was a highly respected ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Dr. Gillespie was a highly respected >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 citizen of Woodsfield having resided here for the past several years. Through this profession he contacted many people thereby making scores of friends who are saddened to learn of his death.
The body was removed to the Bauer, Willison & Turner funeral home where it was prepared for burial and on Wednesday evening was returned to the family home. Funeral services will be held at 1:00 oclock Friday afternoon at the home in charge of Reverend Henry Fox, pastor of St. Pauls Evangelical Church, and burial will be made in ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body was removed to the Bauer, Willison & Turner funeral home where it was prepared for burial and on Wednesday evening was returned to the family home. Funeral services will be held at 1:00 o clock Friday afternoon at the home in charge of Reverend Henry Fox, pastor of St. Paul s Evangelical Church, and burial will be made in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Oaklawn cemetery.
Dr. Gillespie came to Woodsfield from Lebanon about twenty years ago, and in both communities was a very successful physician, due not only to natural ability, but the close application to his profession.

1937
  Death of Mrs. Highman
 Published in The Republican, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, February 18,1937)
 
   Mrs. Emily Williams Highman,75, died suddenly Tuesday morning, at 12:00 o'clock at the family home at Sarahsville, Ohio, following a heart attack. She had been enjoying her usual health and death occurred a few hours after she retired for the night. Her husband , Duncan Highman, died suddenly on Christmas Eve,1935.
   Mrs. Highman had been a resident of Sarahsville about 32 years, moving there with her husband from Woodsfield where they were married in 1885. She was a daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Levi Williams, of Woodsfield, and was a member of The Sarahsville M.E. Church.
   Eight of the twelve children born to Mr. and Mrs. Highman survive as follows: Dana Highman of Chicago, Ill.; A.G. Highman,of Ashland; Mrs. Mary Schumate, of Zanesville; S.O. Highman, Knox Highman, Clem Highman and Miss Rita Highman, of Sarahsville. One sister, Mrs. Mary Devore, of Woodsfield, also survives.
Funeral services were held this Thursday afternoon and burial made in The Village View Cemetery.
 
 

February 25, 1937

DEATH

Miss Nancy Wells

Source: Republican

 

Miss Nancy S. Wells, 88, well known ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Miss Nancy S. Wells, 88, well known >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 resident of near Summerfield, passed away at the home of her nephew, J. O. Carpenter, Tuesday evening at 11:00 o'clock. Death was due to a lingering illness of complications.

Deceased was the daughter of James and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Deceased was the daughter of James and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Julia Stephens Wells. She spent her entire lifetime in and around Calais and Summerfield where she was held in high esteem. She was a member of the Christian Church.

Surviving are one brother, James Wells of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving are one brother, James Wells of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wright, Iowa; one sister, Mrs. S. A. Brownfield, of Woodsfield R. F. D.; a niece, Mrs. Rufus Hannahs, of Zanesville; in addition to other distant relatives in the Summerfield and Calais communities.

Funeral services will be held Friday ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services will be held Friday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 morning from the Seneca Christian Church and burial will be made in the Calais Cemetery

 
1937X
DEATH
Name: Mrs. Francis Heft, nee Harper
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Woodsfield, Ohio, February 25, 1937
Collection of Wild a Heft Bartenschlag
Mrs. Lucille A. Heft, aged 24 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Lucille A. Heft, aged 24 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and wife of Francis Heft of Lewisville, Ohio passed away at her home about 4:30 Monday morning, February 22, 1937. Mrs. Heft gave birth to a daughter on Friday, February 12, 1937 and a few days later suffered an attack of scarlet fever which resulted in her death.
Surviving are her husband, the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Surviving are her husband, the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 infant daughter named Joan Lucille Heft and one son Paul Heft, aged three years. Her father Royden Harper, of Lewisville, Route 2, also survives in addition to the following sisters and brothers: Phyllis Harper, who resides with her grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. James Harper of near Malaga, Ohio; Lloyd Harper of Smithville, Ohio; Vivian and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Lloyd Harper of Smithville, Ohio; Vivian and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ray of Lewisville, Route 2; and Virgil of St. Clairsville, Ohio. Many other relatives also survive. Her mother preceded her in death several years ago.
Mrs. Heft came form a very prominent ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Heft came form a very prominent >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Monroe county family, having resided in Malaga for a number of years.
Private funeral services were held ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Private funeral services were held >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at the home at 9 a.m. Tuesday in charge of Reverend Robert Johnson, pastor of the Lewisville Evangelical Church. Burial was made in Friendship cemetery at Lewisville.
Mrs. Heft was well known in the Lewisville community and had made for herself scores of friends who are deeply grieved to learn of her death. She will be sadly missed not only in the home with by all who knew her. Sincere sympathy is extended to the bereaved family.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Heft was well known in the Lewisville community and had made for herself scores of friends who are deeply grieved to learn of her death. She will be sadly missed not only in the home with by all who knew her. Sincere sympathy is extended to the bereaved family.

DEATH
Name: Miss Joan Lucille Heft
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Issue: Woodsfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Issue: Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio, February, 1937
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
Joan Lucille Heft, two-weeks-old, daughter, born February 12, 1937, of Francis Heft of Lewisville, died Tuesday morning at 12:45 oclock in the Ohio Valley General hospital, Wheeling, West Virginia. The infant was admitted to the hospital, Sunday for medical treatment. The mother, Lucille Heft, passed away February 22nd, after a few days illness with scarlet fever. The child later developed scarlet fever.
Surviving are the father, Francis ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Joan Lucille Heft, two-weeks-old, daughter, born February 12, 1937, of Francis Heft of Lewisville, died Tuesday morning at 12:45 o clock in the Ohio Valley General hospital, Wheeling, West Virginia. The infant was admitted to the hospital, Sunday for medical treatment. The mother, Lucille Heft, passed away February 22nd, after a few days illness with scarlet fever. The child later developed scarlet fever.
Surviving are the father, Francis >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Heft, one brother, Paul Heft, aged three years, grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Heft, of Lewisville, Ohio, and Royden Harper, of Lewisville, Route 2, besides many other relatives.
Private funeral services were held at the home and burial made in Friendship cemetery, near Lewisville.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Private funeral services were held at the home and burial made in Friendship cemetery, near Lewisville. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Bintz-Wichterman

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, dated March 11, 1937

On Saturday, March 6th, Miss ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Saturday, March 6th, Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Freda Bintz, daughter of Elmer Bintz of Lewisville Route 1, became the bride of Alfred Wichterman of near Cameron, son of Albert Wichterman of Elm Grove, W. Va. The ceremony was performed at the M. E. parsonage in Adamsville, O., with the pastor Rev. John F. Herion officiating at the exchange of the vows.

The happy couple will reside on a farm ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The happy couple will reside on a farm >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with the bridegroom's Uncle George Lehman of near Cameron. They have many friends who extend congratulations and best wishes.

1937
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, dated Thursday, April 8, 1937
Marriage Announcement

O. Weber of Lewisville. The wedding was an event of September 12th last, at St. Marys, W. Va., but was kept a secret until the past week.

July 5, 1937X

MARRIAGEXXXXX

Brooks-Kahrig

Source: Monroe Co. Beacon

 

An event of much interest to their many ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> An event of much interest to their many >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 friends was the wedding Miss Marie Kahrig, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Kahrig, of Lewisville Route and Hugh l. Brooks son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Brooks, of Woodsfield R. 6 which occurred on Wednesday, June 30, at 3 o'clock in St. Sylvester Church in Woodsfield. Rev. J. G. Mehler performed the Nuptial Mass with Mr. and Mrs. Leo S. Reischman as attendants,

The bride wore a floor length gown of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride wore a floor length gown of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 white satin with white accessories. The bridesmaid wore a pink organdy floor length gown with white accessories.

At noon a dinner was served at the home ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> At noon a dinner was served at the home >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of the groom. Those present were the bride and groom, Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Brooks, Mr. and Mrs. Leo Reischman, Rev. J. G. Mehler, Mr. and Mrs. Philip Kahrig and daughters Minnie and Sophia, Miss Rose Hohman, Mr. and Mrs. Roman Reischman, Mrs. Gilbert Reischman, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Brooks and daughters Margarete and Eunice.

A dance was given in the evening at the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A dance was given in the evening at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parish hall in Miltonsburg with a large crowd attending. Many lovely gifts were received by the bride and groom for which they want to thank all.

On Thursday morning, they left for a short ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Thursday morning, they left for a short >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wedding trip to Cincinnati and parts of Kentucky. On their return they will make their home with his parents for the present.

DEATH
Name: Miss Gertrude Kuhn
Source: newspaper clipping
Issue: November ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Issue: November >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1937
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
Gertrude Kuhn, daughter of Mr. and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Gertrude Kuhn, daughter of Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. John N. Kuhn, of Lewisville, Ohio route 1, died in St. Francis Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Thursday, November 4, 1937, at the age of 19 years, having been born April 9, 1918.
The body was returned to her home and funeral services were held at St. Joshs Church, Burkhart, Ohio at 9 a.m., ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body was returned to her home and funeral services were held at St. Josh s Church, Burkhart, Ohio at 9 a.m., >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Saturday, November 6th in charge of the Reverend Joseph Finan, pastor of the Church. Interment was in the Church cemetery.
Miss Burkhart was a graduate of Lewisville High School, class of 35. She was a good student, of a lovable ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Burkhart was a graduate of Lewisville High School, class of 35. She was a good student, of a lovable >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 disposition, with kindness and charity for all. Her death comes as a blow to her parents, her family and her friends.
She leaves, besides her father and mother, the following brothers and sister: James Kuhn, of the home; Arthur Kuhn, of Lewisville; Lester and Cornelius, of Louisville, Stark County, Ohio; Mrs. Edwin Crum, of Berne, Ohio, and many other relatives and friends who sincerely mourn her untimely death.
To die is landing on some silent shore,
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She leaves, besides her father and mother, the following brothers and sister: James Kuhn, of the home; Arthur Kuhn, of Lewisville; Lester and Cornelius, of Louisville, Stark County, Ohio; Mrs. Edwin Crum, of Berne, Ohio, and many other relatives and friends who sincerely mourn her untimely death.
To die is landing on some silent shore,

Where billows never break nor tempests roar;
Ere well we feel the friendly stroke tis oer.

S. Brubach and Charles Brubach of Woodsfield was killed Friday when his car was hit by a freight train.

1938 XXXXX
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> XXXXX >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
John Burns McMahon
Source: Newspaper clipping, Monroe County Ohio, April 1938
John B. McMahon, aged 72 years, highly respected resident of West of Woodsfield, passed away at his home Tuesday evening [correct is 12 April 1938] following a two weeks' illness.
He is survived by two sons, William of the home and Albert of Adena, Ohio. Many more distant relatives and scores of friends also mourn his departure.
Funeral services will be held at 2:00 o'clock Friday afternoon at the late home in charge of Minister J. V. A. Traylor, pastor of the Woodsfield Church of Christ. Burial will be made beside his wife in Oaklawn cemetery.
Mr. McMahon was a fine citizen and his death is a personal loss to many friends, as well as to his near relatives.

Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, April 7, 1938
Mrs. Caroline Rhines, age 67, passed away at 12:00 oclock noon, Wednesday , at her home near West Marietta Street, Woodsfield, Ohio following a week's illness. She was the widow of Phillip Rhines, who died four years ago.
Surviving are three sisters, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Caroline Rhines, age 67, passed away at 12:00 o clock noon, Wednesday , at her home near West Marietta Street, Woodsfield, Ohio following a week's illness. She was the widow of Phillip Rhines, who died four years ago.
Surviving are three sisters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Gus Kilburn and Mrs. Henry Kilburn, of Monroefield, and Mrs. Freda Weir, of Okmulgee, Oklahoma; two brothers, Fred Kahrig, of Woodsfield, and Philip Kahrig, of near Lewisville, and many other relatives and friends.
Funeral services will be held at the M. E. Church, Friday afternoon, at 2:00 oclock with the Reverend A. R. Brown officiating. Burial will be made in ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services will be held at the M. E. Church, Friday afternoon, at 2:00 o clock with the Reverend A. R. Brown officiating. Burial will be made in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Oaklawn cemetery.
 
1938
Mary Lorena Sims nee Christman
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated Monday, June 6, 1938
On September 30, 1900, an angel from heaven delivered a bright little babe to the home of Mr. and Mrs. William Thomas Christman, of Woodsfield, Ohio. This babe, their only daughter, was named Mary Lorena. On Tuesday morning, May 17, 1938, God again sent an angel to visit us, this time the angel of Death, who slipped his hand in hers and led her through the dark Valley of Death to again resume her work in Heaven.
At the time of her death she was just 37 years, 7 months and 17 days old.  When she was a small child, she became a member of the First Presbyterian Church. She was married to Pearl E. Sims on June 18, 1916. Five children were born to this union. She leaves to mourn her departure her husband, children Gerald, Ruth, Vera, Edna, Mary Jean, her mother and father, two brothers, Arthur and Walter, and a host of other relatives and friends.
From the beginning of her lengthy illness until her death she was never heard to complain. Until the end her faith in her God was unshaken. Our loving hands and faithful service of our doctors could not help her suffering, so God called her home to a land where pain and sorrow are unknown.
The body was brought to the Bauer, Willison & Turner Funeral Home and returned to the family home, Tuesday evening. Funeral services were held in charge of Rev. Harry Bates of the Free Methodist Church, at the home of her parents on South <<<<<<< HEAD High Street on Thursday afternoon at 2:00 oclock at the home. Her body was ======= High Street on Thursday afternoon at 2:00 o clock at the home. Her body was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 laid to rest in OakLawn Cemetery, where she will await that day when God shall call all men before his throne on High.
 
I cannot say, and I will not say
That she is dead - she is just away!
With a cherry smile, and a wave of the hand,
She has wandered into a better land.
And left us dreaming how very fair
It neets must be, since she lingers there.
And you - O you, who the mildest yearn
For the old-time sleep and the glad return -
Think of her faring on, as dear
In the love of There as the love of Here;
Think of her still as the same, I say:
She is not dead - she is just away.
 

May 19, 1938X

June 13, 1938

BIRTH

Daughter Hall

Source: Beacon

 

An 8 pound daughter was born to Mr. and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> An 8 pound daughter was born to Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Herbert Hall, at their home on South Main Street, early Sunday morning, June 12th. Mrs. Hall will be remembered as the former Miss Clara Brubach. Grandparents of the new arrival are Mrs. J. W. Brubach, of Miltonsburg and Edgar Hall of Woodsfield.

June 13, 1938X

Marriage

Heft-Cree

Source: Beacon

 

======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A Wedding of much interest to their many friends was solemnized Sunday morning, June 5th, at 8:30 o'clock when Miss Ethel Cree, charming daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles N. Cree, and Mr. Stanley Heft, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Heft, were united in marriage. The single ring ceremony was performed by Rev. W. R. Walch, of Lewisville. The couple were unattended.

======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 The bride was attired in a lovely dress of blue lace with white accessories. The groom wore a suit of blue.

======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Heft was graduated from Lewisville High School Class of 1937, and the groom was graduated from Lewisville High School Class of 1935, and is now employed with the local A. & P. Company.

======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 The happy couple will make their home near Lewisville, where their house is in readiness.

======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 They are receiving congratulations and best wishes from their many friends.

June 23, 1938X

DEATH

Lewis Heft, Sr.

Source: The Monroe Co. Republican

 

Lewis Heft. Sr., was born on January 29, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Lewis Heft. Sr., was born on January 29, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1845 in the Rheinpfalz, Bern Germany, and departed this life at the home of his son John, May 20th, at 12:15 a.m. at the age of 93 years, three months and 22 days of age.

At the age of 27 years, Mr. Heft ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> At the age of 27 years, Mr. Heft >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 immigrated to the United States and made his home in New York City where three years later he was united in marriage with Miss Elizabeth Schaefer on May 23, 1875.

This ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> This >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 union was blest with six children: Amelia B., Lewis, Jr., Catherine, Anna Elizabeth, John and Christyne.

Three years after his marriage he moved ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Three years after his marriage he moved >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with his family to a little community near Lewisville, in Summit Township, Monroe County, Ohio where he spent the remainder of his life.

Mr. Heft was confirmed in the Evangelical ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. Heft was confirmed in the Evangelical >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church at the age of 14 years. He remained true to his faith until his death. He was a member of the St. John's Evangelical Middle Church of Summit Township.

He is the last of a family of six ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> He is the last of a family of six >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 children, four girls and two boys. His wife Elizabeth Heft nee Schaefer, passed away on December 5, 1935.

Surviving are five children: Lewis Heft, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving are five children: Lewis Heft, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Jr., of Lewisville; Mrs. Emil J. Widmer of Bound Brook, N. J.; Mrs. John J. Branden of McMechen, W. Va.; John Heft of near Lewisville and Mrs. Carl C. Schailer, of Cleveland, Ohio. One daughter Mrs. John C. Schaaf of Elm Grove, W. Va., preceded him in death ten years ago in July, 1928. Seventeen grandchildren and three great-grandchildren also survive.

 

August 4, 1938X

MARRIAGE

Christman-Pfalzgraf

Source: Monroe Co. Republican

 

"Dollie and Nova, June 30, 1937" ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> "Dollie and Nova, June 30, 1937" >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was the message that was cleverly hidden among the mints in basket favors at a dinner given Tuesday evening in the dining room of the Immanuel Evangelical and Reformed Church of Clarington, announcing the marriage on that date of Miss Dollie Pfalzgraf to Mr. Nova Christman. The announcement was a surprise to everyone. The wedding took place at Cumberland, Maryland.

Mrs. Christman is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Pfalzgraf of Sykes Ridge near Clarington and has been a successful teacher of the primary grades of the Clarington School.

Mr. Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. L. P. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Christman is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Pfalzgraf of Sykes Ridge near Clarington and has been a successful teacher of the primary grades of the Clarington School.

Mr. Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. L. P. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman of North of Woodsfield, is a senior in dentistry at Ohio State University, Columbus.

The dinner was given by Mrs. N. Fuhrer and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The dinner was given by Mrs. N. Fuhrer and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her class of Happy Helpers of the Sunday School and included as guests the members of the Junior Women's Guild and mothers of the Happy Helpers who were: Mrs. Nova Christman, Mrs. Russel Leow, Mrs. C. M. Ward, Mrs. Waiter McFarland, Mrs. E. H. Bassier of Dorseyville Pa., Miss Ruth Dotta, Miss Kathleen Bell, Mrs. J. V. Maury, Miss Juanita Mayers, Mrs. G. Sennewald, Mrs. Jack Burton, Mrs. Leonard Jennewein of Powhattan, Mrs. Fred Hall, Mrs. Paul Howell, Miss Edith Thomas, Mrs. James Pletcher, Mrs. N. Fuhrer, Mrs. Charles Cook, Mrs. William Oneacre, Mrs. A. Daetwyler, Mrs. Lewis Kanzig, Mrs. Chalmer Thomas, Mrs. Elmer Thomas, Misses Delores Thomas, Gladys Oneacre, Mildred Cook, Ethelene Thomas, Helen Ickes, Leona Kanzig, Esther Daetwyler, Helen Thomas, Elverna Miller and Evelyn Cook and Rev. G. Sennewald, all of Clarington.

 
1938XXXXX
DEATH
Name: Lawrence Ackerman
Source: The Spirit of Democracy
Issue: Woodsfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Issue: Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio, August 18, 1938
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Lawrence Ackerman, age 12, was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lawrence Ackerman, age 12, was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 accidentally struck by an automobile driven by Arnold Schwall of Woodsfield last Tuesday afternoon. The accident occurred one mile east of Lewisville on the Lewisville-Woodsfield road. Lawrence suffered a fractured skull and crushed chest when he struck the pavement.
Lawrence was coming toward ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lawrence was coming toward >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield with his little wagon. When he came to the driveway of a filling station, Mr. Schwall approached him from the rear and blew his horn. Instead of turning off the main highway into the driveway to let Mr. Schwall pass, Lawrence turned directly across the pavement in front of the car. It is believed that he thought Mr. Schwall wanted to drive into the driveway of the filling station and turned across the pavement to get out of the way.
Lawrence was removed to a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lawrence was removed to a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Barnesville hospital where he died early Thursday morning.
Since the death of his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Ackerman, he has made his home with Mr. and Mrs. Fred Weber, one mile east of Lewisville. Mabel Ackerman of Woodsfield is a sister of Lawrence.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Since the death of his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Ackerman, he has made his home with Mr. and Mrs. Fred Weber, one mile east of Lewisville. Mabel Ackerman of Woodsfield is a sister of Lawrence. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Hipsher, of Edison, Ohio and William F. Heft, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Heft, Jr., of Lewisville were united in marriage at 4:30 o'clock, Saturday, August 27th at Fort Wayne, Indiana. The single ring service was solemnized by Rev. Howard J. Brown of the Methodist Episcopal Church of that city.

The bride was graduated from the Edison ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride was graduated from the Edison >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 High School, class of '36 and from the Office Training School, Columbus, Ohio.

After September 2, Mr. and Mrs. Heft will ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> After September 2, Mr. and Mrs. Heft will >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 be in their newly furnished home at 3-16th Street, McMechen, W. Va. Mr. Heft is an employee at the Continental Can Company, Wheeling, W. Va.

1939X

William Thomas Christman

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated January 30, 1939

William Thomas Christman, aged 66, passed away at his home  in south Woodsfield, Sunday morning. He had been ill since August. Mr. Christman was the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Louis Christman.

Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Minnie Smith Christman, two sons, Walter, of the home, and Arthur Christman, of Woodsfield, and several grandchildren. His daughter, Mrs. Pearl Sims, preceded him in death several months ago. One brother, Henry Christman, of Woodsfield, R. 3, and one sister, Mrs. Barbara Diehl, of Clinton, Missouri, also survive.

The body was brought to the Bauer, Willison & Turner Funeral Home and returned to the late home, Sunday evening.

Funeral services will be held at the late home, Wednesday afternoon at 2:00 o'clock, with Rev. Harry bates, of Sugar Creek, Ohio, former pastor of the Woodsfield F. M. church, officiating. Burial will be made in OakLawn cemetery.

 

1939X
Mrs. Eva Carper, Obituary in February 13, 1939, The Monroe County Beacon: Mrs. Eva Carper. wife of Harvey Carper passed away at her home northeast of Quaker City, <<<<<<< HEAD Tuesday night, February 7th, at 8:00 oclock following a long illness. She was born in Monroe county, February 19, 1860, and for nearly twenty-eight years lived on the farm where her death occurred. In addition to her husband she is survived by four sisters and one brother: Mrs. Lena Ackerman, of Lewisville; Mrs. Barbara Morris, of Salesville; Mrs. Mary Miller and Mrs. Sally Betts, of Quaker City Rt. and George L. Christman, of Lewisville Rt. She was a member of the Second M. E. Church of Barnesville, and was always greatly interested in the affairs of the church. Funeral services were held on Friday afternoon at 1:00 oclock at the Eberle Funeral Home ======= Tuesday night, February 7th, at 8:00 o clock following a long illness. She was born in Monroe county, February 19, 1860, and for nearly twenty-eight years lived on the farm where her death occurred. In addition to her husband she is survived by four sisters and one brother: Mrs. Lena Ackerman, of Lewisville; Mrs. Barbara Morris, of Salesville; Mrs. Mary Miller and Mrs. Sally Betts, of Quaker City Rt. and George L. Christman, of Lewisville Rt. She was a member of the Second M. E. Church of Barnesville, and was always greatly interested in the affairs of the church. Funeral services were held on Friday afternoon at 1:00 o clock at the Eberle Funeral Home >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in Quaker City. Burial was made in Friends cemetery at Quaker City.

May 1, 1939X

DEATHXXXXX

Mrs. Sally Betts

Source: Beacon

 

Mrs. Sally Betts, well known resident of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Sally Betts, well known resident of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near Taylor, near Quaker City, passed away Friday morning in Swan Hospital in Cambridge. She was aged 63.

A native of Monroe County, she was married ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A native of Monroe County, she was married >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to Dora Betts in 1900. She had resided in the Taylor vicinity for the past 27 years. She was a member of the Seneca Valley Church of Christ.

Surviving besides her husband are the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving besides her husband are the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following children; Josie Betts, of the home; Mrs. Juanita Stevens, of Mt. Vernon; Mrs. Florence Starr, of near Quaker City, and Robert and Earl Betts both of the home. She also leaves three sisters, Mrs. Lena Ackerman, of Lewisville; Mrs. Barbara Morris, of Salesville, and Mrs. Mary Miller of Quaker City and a brother, George L. Christman, of Lewisville.

Following short services at the late ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Following short services at the late >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 residence Sunday afternoon at 1:00 o'clock the body was removed to the Seneca Valley Church of Christ, where last rites were conducted upon arrival. Minister J. V. A. Trayler, of Woodsfield, officiated and burial was in the Taylor Cemetery.

 

1939X
DEATH
Name: Raymond Albert Kahrig
Source: Newspaper clipping , May 1939
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Raymond Albert Kahrig, son of Alfred ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Raymond Albert Kahrig, son of Alfred >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Gertrude Christman Kahrig, was born July 7, 1936, in Malaga township, Miltonsburg, Ohio, and departed this life at 7:30 p.m. Sunday, April 30, 1939, at the age of 2 years, 9 months and 23 days. His death was caused by short illness of the flu.
He was baptized on August 30, 1936.
Short funeral services were held Tuesday afternoon, May 2, at 1 oclock at the home, with final services at St. Johns Evangelical and Reformed Church, summit township, in charge was the Reverend William R. Walch, of Lewisville. Burial was made in the Middle Church cemetery, near Lewisville, Ohio.
