On Saturday morning, January third, at an exquisitely detailed ceremony solemnized in St. Sylvesters Church, Woodsfield, Miss Mabel Ackerman, niece of Mr. and Mrs. Chas. F. Brubach, of Woodsfield, became the bride of Mr. James Carl Sumption, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. V. Sumption, of Jerusalem, Ohio. The vows were exchanged at nine oclock with the Rt. Rev. Msgr. J. G. Mehler officiating at the double ring ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On Saturday morning, January third, at an exquisitely detailed ceremony solemnized in St. Sylvester s Church, Woodsfield, Miss Mabel Ackerman, niece of Mr. and Mrs. Chas. F. Brubach, of Woodsfield, became the bride of Mr. James Carl Sumption, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. V. Sumption, of Jerusalem, Ohio. The vows were exchanged at nine o clock with the Rt. Rev. Msgr. J. G. Mehler officiating at the double ring >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 ceremony.
The bride was given in marriage by her uncle. Mrs. J. M. Byrd, of Athens, Ohio, close friend, was matron of honor. Mr. Byrd served Mr. Sumption as best man. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The bride was given in marriage by her uncle. Mrs. J. M. Byrd, of Athens, Ohio, close friend, was matron of honor. Mr. Byrd served Mr. Sumption as best man. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ushers were Clarence Brubach, of Summerfield, Ohio, and Paul Brooks, of Canton, Ohio.
In the afternoon, Mr. and Mrs. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In the afternoon, Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Sumption left for a wedding trip keeping their destination secret, the bride traveling in a rose crepe dress with matching hat, brown accessories and a brown fur coat. An orchid was worn on the shoulder. Upon returning they will reside in their newly furnished apartment at the Umpleby home on South Main street.
Mrs. Sumption, a graduate of Woodsfield ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Sumption, a graduate of Woodsfield >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 High School, is employed as secretary to County Agent W. H. Coulson.
Mr. Sumption, a graduate of Beallsville High School, is a veteran of World War II, having served eleven months of overseas duty in the European Theatre of War with the 8th Air Force. He is now employed at the Sentinel Printing office.

DEATH
Name: Frieda ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Name: Frieda >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Meisenheimer, nee Neuhart
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Woodsfield, Ohio, February 1948
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
Frieda C. Meisenheimer, daughter of the late Frederick and Marie Neuhart, was born in Lewisville, Ohio, January 14, 1891. She was confirmed in St. Peters Evangelical Church, at Lewisville, Ohio. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Frieda C. Meisenheimer, daughter of the late Frederick and Marie Neuhart, was born in Lewisville, Ohio, January 14, 1891. She was confirmed in St. Peter s Evangelical Church, at Lewisville, Ohio. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Both of her parents died before she reached the age of sixteen. For many years she made her home with her sister, Mrs. Clara Egger, of Lewisville.
On June 22, 1921, she was united in ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On June 22, 1921, she was united in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage with the Reverend P. Walter Meisenheimer. During the twenty-six years of life in the parsonage, she served faithfully with her husband. Their first five years were spent at Trinity Evangelical Church, Loudonville, Ohio. While here, the two sons, Earl Robert and Charles Walter were born. Their next twelve years of service were in Taylor, Pennsylvania; and since August, 1938, they have been in the Hamburg-Eden charge, residing in Hamburg, New York.
Here was a busy life, which was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Here was a busy life, which was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 filled with thoughtful little things, accompanied with a friendly manner and charming smile, that made her unnumbered friends wherever she lived.
Her greatest joy was to make some ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Her greatest joy was to make some >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 child happy with some little kindness - a flower, or a toy. All children greeted her with smiles.
After a prolonged illness of six ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> After a prolonged illness of six >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 months, her earthly pilgrimage came to close on January 7, 1948 lacking one week of reaching her fifty-seventh milestone.
Mourning her passing are her ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mourning her passing are her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, P. Walter Meisenheimer; her two sons and their families, Lt. Earl R. and Louise Meisenheimer and their daughter, Sharon Marie; Charles W. and Helane Meisenheimer, and their daughter, Jill Helane; three sisters, Mrs. Clara Neuhart Egger, Mrs. Laura Neuhart Hehr and Mrs. Josephine Neuhart Hinderlong, all of Lewisville; her stepmother, Mrs. Amelia Matz Neuhart, and a half-brother, Cyril Neuhart, both of Woodsfield.
She was preceded in death by her parents, Frederick and Mary Weber Neuhart; one brother Charles Neuhart and two sisters, , Mrs. Minnie Neuhart McCammon ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She was preceded in death by her parents, Frederick and Mary Weber Neuhart; one brother Charles Neuhart and two sisters, , Mrs. Minnie Neuhart McCammon >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Edna Neuhart Wittenbrook.
Funeral services were held in St. Peters Evangelical and Reformed Church in Lewisville, Monday afternoon with the Reverend Walter M. Trogler, of Woodsfield, and Dr. Paul Saleske, of Mansfield, officiating. Burial was made in the Friendship cemetery by the Gardner funeral home.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services were held in St. Peter s Evangelical and Reformed Church in Lewisville, Monday afternoon with the Reverend Walter M. Trogler, of Woodsfield, and Dr. Paul Saleske, of Mansfield, officiating. Burial was made in the Friendship cemetery by the Gardner funeral home. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
1948
Calvin Hendershot, 74, resident of twenty-seventh and Belmont Street, retired riverman and retired employee of the Wheeling Steel Corp., was found <<<<<<< HEAD dead in his home, where he resided alone yesterday afternoon at 5 oclock by his daughter, Mrs. Frank Lewis of Toronto, Ohio, who came to visit him, learning that he had been ill.  He was born in Monroe County, Ohio.  His wife, Amanda Hendershot, died in 1941.  Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Fred Lewis of Toronto, Ohio, and Mrs. Anthony Vanellaof Columbus, a sister, Mrs. Sadie Vanella of Columbus, a sister, Mrs. Sadie Belford, of Wheeling, a brother, William Hendershot, of Fly, Ohio, died last Monday.  Five grandchildren and two great-grandchildren also survive.  The body was removed to the Walter Bauknecht Funeral Home, where services will be held <<<<<<< HEAD Monday afternoon at 1 oclock, followed by interment in Greenwood ======= Monday afternoon at 1 o clock, followed by interment in Greenwood >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cemetery.  (February 15, 1948, probably Bellaire, OH)

Sylvester Highman, 54, merchant in Sarahsville for forty years, died
suddenly Sunday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Sylvester Highman, 54, merchant in Sarahsville for forty years, died
suddenly Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 night, February 8, at 10:30 o'clock of a heart attack at his home. He had been enjoying his usual health and death occured about one hour after he was stricken.
Mr. Highman ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Highman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born near Woodsfield, a son of Duncan and Emily Williams Highman, and was a member of The Conner Methodist Church near Woodsfield.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio, February 23, 1948

Mrs. Anna L. Gramlich, age 46, of Adamsville road, Zanesville, Ohio, Route 5, died Thursday evening, February 19th, at six oclock at Good Samaritan hospital in Zanesville, following ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Anna L. Gramlich, age 46, of Adamsville road, Zanesville, Ohio, Route 5, died Thursday evening, February 19th, at six o clock at Good Samaritan hospital in Zanesville, following >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 complications from an operation three weeks ago.
A native of Woodsfield, she was the daughter of the late Conrad and Louise Cecil Ackerman. A member of the Pilgrim Evangelical and Reformed Church, Mrs. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A native of Woodsfield, she was the daughter of the late Conrad and Louise Cecil Ackerman. Surviving are her husband, Charles ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Surviving are her husband, Charles >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 C. Gramlich; a son, Edward Gramlich, of Zanesville; a daughter, Miss Helen E. Gramlich, of the home; a daughter-in-law, Mrs. Geraldine Gramlich; a brother, Otto Ackerman, of Miami, Florida, and several nieces and nephews. One son preceded her in death.
The body was brought to the Bauer and Turner funeral home on Sunday morning where funeral services were held at two oclock Sunday afternoon. Reverend Walter Trogler, of St. Pauls Evangelical and Reformed Church, Woodsfield, officiated. Burial was in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body was brought to the Bauer and Turner funeral home on Sunday morning where funeral services were held at two o clock Sunday afternoon. Reverend Walter Trogler, of St. Paul s Evangelical and Reformed Church, Woodsfield, officiated. Burial was in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Miss Estella Emma Bintz, daughter of Mr. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Miss Estella Emma Bintz, daughter of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Wesley B. D. Bintz, of Lewisville, Route 1, was united in marriage with Mr. James Joseph Wehr, son of Mr. and Mrs. Angus Wehr, of Barnesville, Saturday morning, February 28th at nine o'clock. Minister J. V. A. Traylor performed the ceremony at his home on Eastern Avenue, using the double ring ceremony.

The bride was attired in a navy blue, two ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride was attired in a navy blue, two >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 piece suit with blue accessories, and her corsage was of red and white carnations. Carrying out the old tradition she wore for something new, four strand pearls and for something old and borrowed, a bracelet belonging to her grandmother.

The groom wore a blue pin stripe suit with ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The groom wore a blue pin stripe suit with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a white carnation in his lapel.

Witnessing the marriage were the bride's ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Witnessing the marriage were the bride's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents and her grandfather, Benjamin Bintz.

Following the ceremony the bride and groom ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Following the ceremony the bride and groom >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 left for a short wedding trip to Coshocton. On Sunday, February 28th, a wedding dinner was served at the home of bride's parents for the immediate families and friends.

Mr. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Wehr will make their home in Barnesville.

March 25, 1948X

DEATH

Louis Pfalzgraf

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

Relatives here have received word of the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Relatives here have received word of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 death of Louis Pfalzgraf in Parkersburg, W. Va. on January 20. He was born in Monroe County, November 16, 1857, a son of Jacob and Caroline Bintz Pfalzgraf. He left Monroe County with his parents many years ago. He is survived by several children and one brother, John Pfalzgraf. His wife preceded him in death.

Funeral services were held in Parkersburg ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services were held in Parkersburg >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 on Monday, January 23rd, and burial was made in Big Tygart Cemetery.

1948X
(Published in The Monroe County Beacon, June ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> (Published in The Monroe County Beacon, June >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 10, 1948)X
 
Military Services for Pfc. Leland Highman Sunday Afternoon
Funeral services will be held at The Bauer ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Military Services for Pfc. Leland Highman Sunday Afternoon
Funeral services will be held at The Bauer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Turner Funeral Home Sunday afternoon at two o'clock for Pfc. Leland D. Highman who was killed in action in North Africa on May 6, 1943. The body will arrive this Thursday evening at The Bauer and Turner Funeral Home from Columbus, accompanied by a military escort, and will be taken to the home of his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Highman, near West Marietta Street, Friday. The body will be returned to the funeral home on Sunday morning.
The services will be conducted by Rev. Wm. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The services will be conducted by Rev. Wm. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 M. Miller, of The Methodist Church. Full military honors will be conducted by Monroe County Post No. 5303, Veterans of Foreign Wars. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery.
Pfc. Highman was inducted into The Army, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Pfc. Highman was inducted into The Army, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 March 6, 1941, from Middletown where he had been employed for about three years with The Lamneck Sheet Metal Products Company. He had been stationed in North Africa for about one year, previous to his death. He was slightly wounded on April 23, 1943, but had recovered from these injuries and was again on the battlefield.
Leland was born on February 16, 1919, and was reared on Conner Ridge near Woodsfield. Surviving are his widow, Mrs. Martha Haynes Highman Glock, and a daughter, Velma Louise, age six years, of West Jefferson, Ohio; his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Highman; and the following sisters and brothers; Mrs. O. T. Gatten, of Lewisville, Rt. 2; Mrs. William Hines, of Lewisville, Star Route; Glenn Highman, of Woodsfield; Gerald Highman, of Lewisville, Route 2; Edsel Highman of near Graysville, and Mrs. Albert Dalrymple, on ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Leland was born on February 16, 1919, and was reared on Conner Ridge near Woodsfield. Surviving are his widow, Mrs. Martha Haynes Highman Glock, and a daughter, Velma Louise, age six years, of West Jefferson, Ohio; his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Highman; and the following sisters and brothers; Mrs. O. T. Gatten, of Lewisville, Rt. 2; Mrs. William Hines, of Lewisville, Star Route; Glenn Highman, of Woodsfield; Gerald Highman, of Lewisville, Route 2; Edsel Highman of near Graysville, and Mrs. Albert Dalrymple, on >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, Route 2
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

DEATH
HIGHMAN
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> HIGHMAN >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated April 5, 1948
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit
Abner ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Abner >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Highman, son of Duncan and Sarah M. Highman, was born in Wayne Township, June 13, 1868. He departed this life at his home on Woodsfield, Route 2, Thursday, April 1st, being at the time of his departure 79 years, 9 months and 18 days of age.
His illness began a year ago which ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His illness began a year ago which >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 he bore patiently until the end. All that medical skill and tender care could do was done, but God saw fit to call him from this world unseen to us.
He was united in marriage with ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was united in marriage with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Phoebe Drake on January 10, 1889, and to this union six children were born, all of whom survive: Otto Highman, of Woodsfield, Route 2; Alonzo Highman, of Ashland, Ohio; Jay Highman of Lewisville, Ohio, Route; David Highman, Mrs. D. S. Williams and Mrs. A. E. Cline, of Woodsfield, Route 2.
Also surviving besides his wife and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Also surviving besides his wife and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the children, are the following brothers; Oliver Highman of Woodsfield, Route 2; Hamilton Highman of Woodsfield; and Oscar Highman of near Graysville, Ohio; twenty-seven grandchildren; twenty-two great grandchildren and a host of more distant relatives and friends.
He was preceded in death by his ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was preceded in death by his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 father, mother, and the following brothers and sister; William Highman, James Highman, Clarence Highman and Mrs. D. E. Hartshorn.
Mr. Highman was a successful farmer, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Highman was a successful farmer, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a faithful husband, a good neighbor, and a loving father. His passing is a hard burden to bear by the family, but we submit to Him who doeth all things well.
He was a member of the Connor ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was a member of the Connor >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Methodist Church and lived consistent in the belief and teaching of his church.
Brief funeral services were held at the late home Saturday afternoon at 1:30 oclock, with additional services at two oclock at he Connor Ridge Methodist Church. Minister J. V. A. Traylor ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Brief funeral services were held at the late home Saturday afternoon at 1:30 o clock, with additional services at two o clock at he Connor Ridge Methodist Church. Minister J. V. A. Traylor >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 officiated. Burial was in the church cemetery with the Gardner Funeral Home of Stafford in charge.
 
 

June 14, 1948X

DEATH

Neva Marie Christman

Source, Monroe County Beacon

 

Neva Marie, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Neva Marie, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Walter F. Christman, of the Miltonsburg-Calais Road died in the Barnesville Hospital Thursday night at ten o'clock. Neva, who would have been eight years old July 24th, was accidentally cut with a scythe in the leg at her home about 7:30 in the evening. She was brought to Woodsfield where first aid was given her, and then removed to the hospital.

Surviving are her parents; six sisters and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving are her parents; six sisters and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 three brothers, Kathryn, of Akron; Florence, of Barnesville; Clyde, Ralph, Eva Pearl, Janice, Doris, Peggy Jo and Don all of the home; also her maternal grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Ira Wehr of Batesville.

V. A. Traylor officiating. Interment was in the Calais Cemetery with the Brubach Funeral home of Summerfield in charg

DEATH
Name: Cpl. Lester E. Ullman
Source: Newspaper clipping
July 8, 1948
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
The body of Cpl. Lester E. Ullman ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body of Cpl. Lester E. Ullman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 formerly of Lewisville, Ohio was brought to Marietta on Wednesday and taken to the Gardner funeral home in Stafford, Ohio. It will remain there until this Thursday evening when it will be removed to the home of his father, Walter Ullman.
Short funeral services will be held at the family home Friday afternoon at 1:30 followed by final rites at the Sutherland Methodist Church with the Reverend Glen Peoples officiating assisted by the Reverend William Miller who was a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Short funeral services will be held at the family home Friday afternoon at 1:30 followed by final rites at the Sutherland Methodist Church with the Reverend Glen Peoples officiating assisted by the Reverend William Miller who was a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 chaplain during World War II.
Burial will be made in Stafford. The Veterans of Foreign Wars, Post No. 5303 ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Burial will be made in Stafford. The Veterans of Foreign Wars, Post No. 5303 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will attend in a group and will conduct military services at the grave.
Cpl. Lester E. Ullman, 28, son of Walter Ullman and the late ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Cpl. Lester E. Ullman, 28, son of Walter Ullman and the late >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Myrtle Ullman of Lewisville Route 2 was born near Stafford on Christmas Day 1914 and departed this life in North Africa September 5, 1943. He attended school at Huffman and Lewisville high school and was graduated from the Woodsfield high school in 1933.
He was a member of Mt. Zion ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was a member of Mt. Zion >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Methodist Church and of Huffman Grange.
Lester remained at home with his ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lester remained at home with his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 father until 24 years of age and went to Cleveland in 1939 where he was employed in a steel plant. He was inducted into the army in Cuyahoga Falls July 10, 1942, sailing from New York in December 1942. He died in North Africa September 5, 1943.
Cpl. Ullman is survived by his ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Cpl. Ullman is survived by his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 father, Walter Ullman of Route 2, Lewisville; one sister Mrs. Dorothy Kestner of Ashland, Ohio; his grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Henry Ullman of Stafford and his grandmother, Mrs. James Mallett of Lewisville. There are many other relatives and a host of friends who are saddened by the death.
He was preceded in death by his mother, Mrs. Myrtle Ullman on January 2, 1931; Clesson E. Ullman on March 15, 1924. Another brother James Ullman was drowned after Lester died in Africa.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was preceded in death by his mother, Mrs. Myrtle Ullman on January 2, 1931; Clesson E. Ullman on March 15, 1924. Another brother James Ullman was drowned after Lester died in Africa. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

1948XXXXX
Lucinda Belford was born May 12, 1864, and passed away Sunday, August 22, 1948, at the age of 84 years, three months and ten days.  She was the daughter of the late Caspar and Frances Hendershot and the last of a family of ten children.  On May 16, 1883, she was married to Henry Belford and was the mother of four children, all surviving her.  Mr. Belford preceded her in death May 12, 1939.  She was a life long member of the Locust Grove church and was regular in attendance as health permitted.  Mrs. Belford will be missed in the home, church and the community, as she was interested in her friends and her family.  Surviving are two daughters and two sons, Mrs. Sadie Hoskinson of Sardis, Mrs. Cleora Tenley of Sardis, Oliver Belford of Fly and Arthur Belford of Sardis, fifteen grandchildren, 38 great-grandchildren and many other relatives and friends. 
 
So then, good night, Mother, only good night
Turn thy dear face to the mansions of light.
Life is so wonderful, life such as thine,
Death cannot end it, Good night, Mother mine.
 
Funeral services were held Tuesday afternoon at one <<<<<<< HEAD oclock at the Rush Funeral Home with final services at the Locust Grove Church at two oclock with Rev. Samuel Huffman and Rev. Donald Smith conducting the ======= o clock at the Rush Funeral Home with final services at the Locust Grove Church at two o clock with Rev. Samuel Huffman and Rev. Donald Smith conducting the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services.  Interment was in the Locust Grove Cemetery.

1948
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 1948 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
James V. Johnson
JAMES V. JOHNSON STRICKEN IN HOME  (brother of Adam D. Johnson) Quaker City-Oct. 4
James V. Johnson, 89, a native of Monroe County but a resident of near this community 41 years died at 10:05 p.m. Wednesday in his home here after an illness of several weeks.  He was born May 29, 1862 and spent most of his life farming.  He was the last of seven children and a member of the Quaker City Methodist church.  Besides his widow, Jennie Stephens Johnson he is survived by a daughter, MissHelen of the home.  A son, Paul, died Aug. 16, 1948.  The body is in the Eberle funeral home where services are to be held at 2 o'clock Saturday afternoon.  Burial will be in Friends cemetery.
 
James V. Johnson, 89, died Wednesday, Oct. 3rd, at his home in Quaker City following a several weeks illness.  A son of James and Nancy Steele Johnson, he was born in Monroe county on May 29, 1862 and moved to Quaker City more that forty-one years ago.  The last of a family of seven children, he was a member of the Quaker City Methodist church.  Surviving are his wife Jennie Stephen Johnson, and one daughter, Helen of the home.  A sone, Paul, died in 1948.
 
 

December 6, 1948X

MARRIAGE

Weber - Roberts

Source: Beacon

 

Cpl. Roger Crum Weber, son of Mr. and Mrs. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cpl. Roger Crum Weber, son of Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Solomon H. Weber, of Lewisville, Route 2, and Miss Ruth Roberts, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Roberts, of 114 Offenbacherstrafie, Nu-Iselberg, Germany were united in marriage in Evangelical Church in Nu-Iselberg, Germany on September 25th.

Mr. and Mrs. Weber have arrived at the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. and Mrs. Weber have arrived at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 home of his parents near Lewisville, from Germany having recently been given his discharge from the U. S. Army.

On Saturday evening, November 27th ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Saturday evening, November 27th >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. and Mrs. Weber were guests of honor at a shower at the Lewisville I.O.O.F. Lodge hall when about one hundred and fifty relatives and friends extended to them their congratulations and best wishes with their gifts.

On Sunday, November 28, they again were ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On Sunday, November 28, they again were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 honored with a family dinner at the Weber home when for the first time since before the war all the children of Mr. and Mrs. Weber were together. There are six sons and one daughter, five of the sons having served in U.S. Military forces in the recent war. There are six grandchildren.

 

December 6, 1948X

DEATH

Paul Pfalzgraf

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

Second Lieutenant Paul Pfalzgraf, age 23 ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Second Lieutenant Paul Pfalzgraf, age 23 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Cameron who was killed in Bain Italy, on January 15, 1945, was brought to the Rush Funeral Home in Clarington last Thursday evening. They body was removed to the late home in Cameron Saturday afternoon. Services were held Sunday afternoon in the home with Minister Elmer Taylor in charge. Interment was in the Oaklawn Cemetery at Woodsfield. Surviving are his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Sam Pfalzgraf, two brothers, Fred of Cameron and John of Canton; two sisters, Mrs. Ray Blachly, of Canal Fulton and Miss Helen of Canton.

 

December 6, 1948X

DEATH

Bruce Thomas Christman

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

Funeral services for Bruce Thomas ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Funeral services for Bruce Thomas >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christman, one year old, were held Friday afternoon at two o'clock at the Bauer and Turner Funeral Home with Rev. E. A. Gradwohl of St. Paul's Evangelical and Reformed Church, officiating. Interment was in the Oaklawn Cemetery.

The baby died Wednesday evening, December ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The baby died Wednesday evening, December >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1st at the home of his parents, Dr. and Mrs. Nova A. Christman, in Eastern Avenue after a lengthy illness.

In addition to his parents, he is survived ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In addition to his parents, he is survived >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by two sisters, Charlotte and Katherine and one brother, John Louis; his paternal grandfather, L. P. Christman of Woodsfield, Route 3, and his maternal grandmother, Mrs. J. W. Pfalzgraf, of Woodsfield. The baby's mother is the former Miss Dolly Pfalzgraf, of Clarington.

 

 
1948
DEATH
Name: Herman J. Egger
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Woodsfield, Ohio, December 1948
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
Herman J. Egger, age 67, well known ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Herman J. Egger, age 67, well known >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and prosperous farmer of the Lewisville community, died in Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, Ohio, on Tuesday evening, December 14, 1948. Having been in failing health for some time, he was admitted to Cleveland Clinic on Tuesday, December 7th, undergoing a major operation last Thursday.
The body was brought to the Gardner ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body was brought to the Gardner >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 funeral home at Stafford and will be taken to the family home four miles north of Lewisville, Ohio this Thursday afternoon.
Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Minnie ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Minnie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Claus Egger; one daughter, Mrs. Gladys Landefeld, of Freeport, Ohio; one son, Elwood Egger, of the home; three grandchildren, and one brother, Homer Egger, of Barnesville, Ohio.
Short funeral services will be held at the home Saturday afternoon at one oclock, with additional services at the St. Johns Evangelical and Reformed Middle Church, near Lewisville at two oclock. Reverend Floyd L. Workman, of Lewisville, will officiate. Burial will ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Short funeral services will be held at the home Saturday afternoon at one o clock, with additional services at the St. John s Evangelical and Reformed Middle Church, near Lewisville at two o clock. Reverend Floyd L. Workman, of Lewisville, will officiate. Burial will >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 be in the Church cemetery.

MARRIAGE (double)XXXXX
Names: Mr. Vernon Seebach
and Miss Beulah Christman;
Mr. Albert Ball
and Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Names: Mr. Vernon Seebach
and Miss Beulah Christman;
Mr. Albert Ball
and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Vonna Winland
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Woodsfield, Ohio, 1948
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
On Christmas Eve, December 24, 1948, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On Christmas Eve, December 24, 1948, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 before an altar decorated with an electric lighted Christmas tree and cross, candles and potted plants, which was beautiful for the occasion, Miss Beulah Christman and Vernon Seebach, and Miss Vonna Winland and Albert Ball, were united in marriage in a double wedding ceremony in the Methodist Church at Lewisville, Ohio. Reverend Floyd L. Workman, pastor of the Church, officiated, using the double ring service. The couples were unattended.
Miss Christman was attired in an ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Christman was attired in an >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 aqua blue dress with silver sequins and black accessories. Her corsage was of red roses.
Miss Winland wore a lightning blue ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Winland wore a lightning blue >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 dress with silver sequins and grey accessories. Her corsage consisted of white roses.
The traditional something old, new, borrowed and blue, was carried out.
Mr. Seebach and Mr. ball each wore a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Seebach and Mr. ball each wore a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 blue suit with a white carnation in his lapel.
Mrs. Seebach is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clem Christman of Lewisville Route. Mr. Seebach is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Seebach, of Lewisville, Ohio. The couple is making their home in Ashland, Ohio, where ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Seebach is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clem Christman of Lewisville Route. Mr. Seebach is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Seebach, of Lewisville, Ohio. The couple is making their home in Ashland, Ohio, where >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 they are employed
The new Mrs. Ball is the only daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Winland, of Lewisville. Mr. Ball is the son of Mrs. Ella Ball, of Prospect Avenue, Barnesville, Ohio and the late Charles Ball. They plan to make their home in canton, Ohio where Mr. Ball is employed.
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The new Mrs. Ball is the only daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Winland, of Lewisville. Mr. Ball is the son of Mrs. Ella Ball, of Prospect Avenue, Barnesville, Ohio and the late Charles Ball. They plan to make their home in canton, Ohio where Mr. Ball is employed. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 

December 27, 1948XXXXX

DEATH

Rosena Agin

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

Mrs. Rosena Agin, a life long resident of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Rosena Agin, a life long resident of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Monroe County passed away at the home of her daughter, Mrs. Edgar Hall, on South Main Street, Thursday evening, December 23 at nine o'clock at the age of 83 years, ten months and nine days.

She was born near Coats Station, a ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She was born near Coats Station, a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Fred and Christina Kindelberger. She was one of eight children all of whom preceded her in death except one sister, Mrs. O. R. Baker, of Wichita, Kansas.

On September 10, 1885 she was united in ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> On September 10, 1885 she was united in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage with Lewis Milton Agin who preceded her in death on June 18, 1927. To this union were born seven sons and three daughters.

At the early age of seventeen she was ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> At the early age of seventeen she was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 confirmed in St. Paul's Evangelical Church, later transferring her membership to the Neuhart Baptist Church where she remained faithful as long as health permitted.

She leaves to mourn five sons and three daughters: Fred of Newark, Ohio; Charlie of the home; Mrs. Edgar (Lillie) Hall, of Woodsfield, with whom she made her home for the past three years; Clyde, of Circleville, Ohio; Roger of Norwich, O.; Mrs. Mark (Gladys) Nalley of Grandville, Mich; and Mrs. Carroll ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She leaves to mourn five sons and three daughters: Fred of Newark, Ohio; Charlie of the home; Mrs. Edgar (Lillie) Hall, of Woodsfield, with whom she made her home for the past three years; Clyde, of Circleville, Ohio; Roger of Norwich, O.; Mrs. Mark (Gladys) Nalley of Grandville, Mich; and Mrs. Carroll >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Grace) Bishop of Mansfield, Ohio twins; and Arthur, of Grand Rapids, Michigan. Seventeen grandchildren and six great-grandchildren also survive.

Two sons, George, age 16 and Harry, age 3 ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Two sons, George, age 16 and Harry, age 3 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded her in death several years ago.

Mrs. Agin bore her sickness with patience and with a smile for all. She was a kind and loving mother, always thoughtful of her children and others. She ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Agin bore her sickness with patience and with a smile for all. She was a kind and loving mother, always thoughtful of her children and others. She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be sadly missed by the children and all who knew her.

Brief funeral services were held Sunday ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Brief funeral services were held Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon at the Schumacher Funeral Home with additional services at the Neuhart Baptist Church, Minister J. V. A. Traylor officiated. She was laid to rest in the Neuhart Cemetery.

 
1949
DEATH
Name: Arthur W. Paine
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Woodsfield, Ohio, 1949
Collection of Wilda Heft Bartenschlag
Arthur W. Paine, age 37, of Monahans, Texas, passed away Tuesday morning at 9:15 oclock in Memorial ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Arthur W. Paine, age 37, of Monahans, Texas, passed away Tuesday morning at 9:15 o clock in Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Hospital, New York City, where he had been a patient for two weeks. Mr. Paine had been ill health for some time and came back east about one month ago.
The body arrived at the Steele Funeral Home in Somerton, Ohio Wednesday noon. Funeral services will be held at the funeral home Friday afternoon at 1:30 oclock E. S. T. with the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The body arrived at the Steele Funeral Home in Somerton, Ohio Wednesday noon. Funeral services will be held at the funeral home Friday afternoon at 1:30 o clock E. S. T. with the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reverend M. LaFollette, of Beallsville, Ohio officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield.
Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Herzel Roberts Paine and two daughters, Carolyn and Sue Ann; his father, William Paine, of Ozark, Ohio; one sister, Mrs. Mary Gray, of Titusville, Pennsylvania, and four brothers, Newell Paine, of Barnesville, Ohio; Herman Paine, of the home; Gene Paine, of New Martinsville, West Virginia and Charles ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Surviving are his wife, Mrs. Herzel Roberts Paine and two daughters, Carolyn and Sue Ann; his father, William Paine, of Ozark, Ohio; one sister, Mrs. Mary Gray, of Titusville, Pennsylvania, and four brothers, Newell Paine, of Barnesville, Ohio; Herman Paine, of the home; Gene Paine, of New Martinsville, West Virginia and Charles >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 W. Paine, Jr. of Crooksville, Ohio.
Mr. Paine owned an oil well supply ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Paine owned an oil well supply >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 store in Texas. He was a member of the Methodist Church at Ozark and the Masonic Lodge at Beallsville. Masonic services will be held at the funeral home <<<<<<< HEAD on Thursday evening.
